results.title: The Wiggles movie [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Dean Covell, Hilton Fatt, Gladusaurus Productions and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The Wiggles - Murray, Jeff, Anthony and Greg are planning a surprise birthday party for their friend Dorothy the Dinosaur. There is a big problem however, their guest of honor has gone missing, she’s in pursuit of a magician who has stolen Greg’s wand, and is upset to think her friends have forgotten her birthday. The Wiggles begin a pursuit of their own when they try to locate Dorothy in time for her party, having a wiggling good time along the way. This is The Wiggles first feature length film and includes seven new songs. Cast also includes Tony Harvey, Leeanne Ashley, Carolyn Ferrie, Paul Paddick, John Field and Joanne Samuel. Also available on VHS [310707]

results.title: The Rage in Placid Lake
results.creator_credit: Tony McNamara, Marian MacGowan, Film Finance Corporation Australia, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Rapacious Pictures and Showtime
results.brief_description: A boy called “Placid Lake” is becoming a man. Tormented all through school for being different and for being the product of his new age parents, Placid (Ben Lee) has a reason for being angry. He decides to exact a type of revenge on his parents by having a career in insurance. Helped through life by his academically brilliant and crayon-chewing friend Gemma (Rose Byrne), will Placid survive the bland 9-to-5 of corporate life? Written and directed by Tony McNamara, adapted from his play “The Cafe Latte Kid”. Features music by Ben Lee and Cezary Skubiszewski. Cast includes Garry McDonald, Miranda Richardson.

results.title: Napoleon (1994) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Mario Andreacchio, Michael Bourchier, Film Australia, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Herald Ace
results.brief_description: This live action Australian adventure follows an adorable pup on a cross-country search for the dingoes who comprise his doggy roots. Though the cocky young puppy’s real name is Muffin, he prefers to think of himself as Napoleon, a conquering warrior. Napoleon gets more than he bargained for when he is carried aloft in a makeshift air balloon into unknown territory. Embarking on a journey that will turn any pup into a warrior, he dares to go where no pup has gone before; discovering unknown lands and meeting some real friends along the way. [VHS 309191]

results.title: Treasure planet
results.creator_credit: John Musker, Ron Clements, Roy Conli and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Walt Disney animated feature based on the novel “Treasure Island” by Robert Louis Stevenson. A dazzling mix with the feel of an old costumed pirate drama combined with space travel adventure. A small boy reads an animated adventure book about pirates on a quest for treasure, all set in space. The sea is replaced by space and the bad pirate is a cyborg, but the story of the personal growth of the young male protagonist is timeless.

results.title: The Spanish apartment = L'Auberge Espagnole
results.creator_credit: Cedric Klapisch, Bruno Levy, Ce Qui Me Meut and Fox Searchlight Pictures
results.brief_description: Written and directed by Cedric Klapisch, “The Spanish Apartment”, a French/Spanish co-production, investigates the issue of whether or not a job makes us who we really are. In the quest to find a steady job, Xavier (Romain Duris) heads off to Spain for a year of post-graduate study leaving his girlfriend (Audrey Tautou) and mother behind in France. He meets a French married couple with whom he develops a friendship, particularly with the wife. Moving into a share-apartment with other students he acquires a broader knowledge of women and life from his friends and their lives there. Not only learning more on Spanish politics and economy he develops his knowledge of the Spanish language. Does he find himself though? Cast includes Judith Godreche, Cecile De France, Kelly Reilly, Christina Brondo, Federico D’Anna, Barnaby Metschurat, Christian Pagh, Kevin Bishop, Xavier De Guillebon.

results.title: It's a very merry Muppet Christmas movie
results.creator_credit: Kirk Thatcher, Martin G. Baker, Warren Carr, Jim Henson, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description: It’s the night before Christmas and the Muppet Theatre is under threat of being demolished. Stars the usual Muppet gang of Miss Piggy, Kermit and others, who all rally and with some divine intervention and funny send-ups of holiday movie cliches, to reveal the film’s message is love will save the day (as well as a good song and dance number!). Humans that also feature are David Arquette, Joan Cusack and Whoopi Goldberg. Directed by Kirk R Thatcher and produced by Martin G Baker and Warren Carr.

results.title: Mission: impossible
results.creator_credit: Brian De Palma, Cruise/Wagner and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Tom Cruise stars in this high action remake of the television series. The film is an action packed, gadget filled blockbuster with twisting plots, glamour and double crossing secret agents. “Mission: Impossible” is a big-production exciting spy thriller. Cast includes Jon Voight, Emmanuelle Beart, Henry Czerny, Jean Reno, Kristin Scott-Thomas and Vanessa Redgrave.

results.title: Pink Floyd: Pulse
results.creator_credit: David Mallet, Lana Topham, Picture Music International (PMI) and Pink Floyd (1987) Ltd
results.brief_description: Recorded live at Earls Court, London on October 20th, 1994. This is classic Pink Floyd performing some of their best known music including “Learning to fly”, “Another brick in the wall”, “Money”, “Us and them”, and “Comfortably numb”. Features David Gilmour, Nick Mason and Richard Wright with Sam Brown, Claudia Fontaine, Durga McBroom on backing vocals, Jon Carin on keyboard and vocals, Dick Parry on saxophone, Tim Renwick on guitars and vocals and Gary Wallis on percussion.

results.title: With time to kill
results.creator_credit: James Clayden, AFTRS, Australian Film Commission and Chair Films
results.brief_description: Filmed on location in Melbourne this is a tale of justice and revenge when two cops decide that the court system has failed and it is now up to them to take the law into their own hands. Cast includes Ian Scott, Elizabeth Huntley, Jan Friedl, James Clayden, John Howard, Stephen Cummins, Barry Dickins, Joe Dolce, Nigel Buesst, Neil Gladwin. Music by Chris Knowles, Stephen Cummins, Ollie Olsen. Director of photography, Laurie McInnes.

results.title: The Last unicorn [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Arthur Rankin Jnr, Jules Bass, Bass in association with ITC Films and Rankin-Bass Productions
results.brief_description: This classic fairy tale for audiences of all ages tells the story of a beautiful unicorn who leaves her home in the lilac woods in the hope of finding another unicorn somewhere in the world. Escorted by Schmendrick, an inept wizard, she tries to find King Haggard’s castle where the evil red bull lives. The distinguished cast of voices includes Mia Farrow, Alan Arkin, Jeff Bridges, Angela Lansbury, Tammy Grimes, Christopher Lee and Keenan Wynn. Based on the novel by Peter S. Beagle.
